intro: Psychotria nematopoda, commonly known as the "red psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, bright red flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria nematopoda is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine.
